title: How to deal with outrageous motions?

arguments.text: If an administrator knew that a coach had students debate the topic of making rape legal, the coach would be at significant risk of losing their job.
arguments.speaker: S2

arguments.text: Debating the topic of making rape legal is wildly inappropriate.
arguments.speaker: S2

arguments.text: Any adult who works with young people should know that debating the topic of making rape legal is inappropriate.
arguments.speaker: S2

arguments.text: The scenario described is cringe-worthy.
arguments.speaker: S3

arguments.text: There can be value in using lopsided resolutions in a practice setting when accompanied by significant guidance from the coach.
arguments.speaker: S5

arguments.text: The resolution to make rape legal is offensive and inappropriate.
arguments.speaker: S5

arguments.text: The weakness of the resolution to make rape legal is its offensive and inappropriate nature, not its one-sidedness.
arguments.speaker: S5

arguments.text: Parents should be informed about the assigned topic.
arguments.speaker: S5

arguments.text: A school administrator should be alerted about the assigned topic.
arguments.speaker: S5

arguments.text: Someone in a position of authority needs to inform the coach that this topic is not okay and must never be repeated.
arguments.speaker: S5

arguments.text: There is no debate to the topic of making rape legal.
arguments.speaker: S8

arguments.text: It was unacceptable for the coach to make students debate the topic of making rape legal.
arguments.speaker: S8

arguments.text: The coach's actions are inappropriate and could end an educator's career.
arguments.speaker: S9

arguments.text: The coach's actions violate the main principles of safeguarding.
arguments.speaker: S9

arguments.text: The coach's actions should be reported.
arguments.speaker: S9

arguments.text: One should reconsider their relationship and contact with the person for their own safety if they are uncomfortable reporting the actions.
arguments.speaker: S9

arguments.text: The coach should be reported.
arguments.speaker: S10

arguments.text: The coach's actions are unacceptable.
arguments.speaker: S10

arguments.text: The coach should be reported.
arguments.speaker: S11

arguments.text: The coach should not be working with children.
arguments.speaker: S11

arguments.text: The coach should be reported to an administrator.
arguments.speaker: S12

arguments.text: If the coach is not an employee of a school, one should stop working with them.
arguments.speaker: S12

arguments.text: A coach suggesting the topic is concerning.
arguments.speaker: S4

arguments.text: The topic is outrageous and a bad choice by the coach.
arguments.speaker: S13

arguments.text: The one-sided topic is offensive and inappropriate.
arguments.speaker: S13

arguments.text: Engaging in this activity with children is inappropriate.
arguments.speaker: S14

arguments.text: What the coach did was not acceptable.
arguments.speaker: S15

arguments.text: One should talk to an administrator if the coach's actions made people uncomfortable.
arguments.speaker: S15

arguments.text: The spirit of debate is education and accessibility.
arguments.speaker: S15
